linkTarget.anchoringText: This study is executed within complex clastic reservoir deposited in Jurassic period in Xinjiang oilfield, which is located in the Junggar Basin, northwest of China (Figure 1). The sedimentary environment is represented by braided river todeltadeposits (Xin et al., 2014, and Wang et al., 2008). The lithology ischaracterized with conglomerate and coarse sandstones interbedded with medium and fine sandstonesthat normal form graded bedding sequences. The oil-bearing grade is also varying over short interval. In addition to the above, the rock texture differs significantly and can range from massive conglomerates to laminated pebbly sandstones.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Location map of the study area-Jungar Basin. (Kuuskraa et al., 2013)

formatted-caption.caption-text: Location map of the study area-Jungar Basin. (Kuuskraa et al., 2013)

linkTarget.bib: Kuuskraa, V.A., Moodhe, K. Stevens S.H. , (2013), "China Shale Gas and Shale Oil Resource Evaluation and Technical Challenges", Society of Petroleum Engineers Doi: 10.2118/165832-MS.

linkTarget.anchoringText: From core observation, the conglomerate is interbedded with sandstone and the oil-bearing grade is varying even in very short interval. From the image texture analysis, it is obvious that the rock is massive and the particle size is varying a lot even within one meter interval. Consequently, the image data and core data indicated the study area is high heterogeneous clastics reservoir (Figure 2).

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: High heterogeneity of rock texture and oil bearing grade.a) plot shows the heterogeneity of the lithology and oil bearing grade. From the bottom to top. There are two normal graded bedding sequence: the lithology is changing from conglomerate to coarse sandstone in the bottom interval and from conglomerate to coarse sandstone, fine grained sandstone in the top interval. The oil bearing grade is higher within the coarse sand interval.b) plot shows the scanned core image. It also reflected the high heterogeneity of the lithology and oil bearing grade.c) plot shows the interbedded character of conglomerate and sandstone. The rock texture is very clear: the conglomerate is massive structure and the sandstone is lamination structure.

formatted-caption.caption-text: High heterogeneity of rock texture and oil bearing grade.a) plot shows the heterogeneity of the lithology and oil bearing grade. From the bottom to top. There are two normal graded bedding sequence: the lithology is changing from conglomerate to coarse sandstone in the bottom interval and from conglomerate to coarse sandstone, fine grained sandstone in the top interval. The oil bearing grade is higher within the coarse sand interval.b) plot shows the scanned core image. It also reflected the high heterogeneity of the lithology and oil bearing grade.c) plot shows the interbedded character of conglomerate and sandstone. The rock texture is very clear: the conglomerate is massive structure and the sandstone is lamination structure.

The oil bearing grade is higher within the coarse sand interval.
plot shows the scanned core image. It also reflected the high heterogeneity of the lithology and oil bearing grade.
plot shows the interbedded character of conglomerate and sandstone. The rock texture is very clear: the conglomerate is massive structure and the sandstone is lamination structure.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The conventional logs have the similar response within coarse sandstone and conglomerates (Figure 3).

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Plot showing the similar log response within conglomerate and coarse sand intervals.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Plot showing the similar log response within conglomerate and coarse sand intervals.

linkTarget.anchoringText: One key well with a total cored interval of 140.43 m within the target formation has been utilized for this integrated approach. The geological markers such as lithology interface and sedimentary structure are used for core-log matching. For this well, the detailed core location was executed for each core interval (Figure 4).

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Showing core to image depth matching process.a) plot shows the lithology interface between conglomerate and coal is applied as marker for core location b) plot shows the cross bedding developed in the coarse sand is applied as marker for core location

formatted-caption.caption-text: Showing core to image depth matching process.a) plot shows the lithology interface between conglomerate and coal is applied as marker for core location b) plot shows the cross bedding developed in the coarse sand is applied as marker for core location

figure-specific-caption.caption-text: plot shows the lithology interface between conglomerate and coal is applied as marker for core location
plot shows the cross bedding developed in the coarse sand is applied as marker for core location

linkTarget.anchoringText: From the core observation, 15 different lithology and five oil bearing grades are identified (Figure 5). The lithology is mainly fine grained sandstone in the bottom interval, conglomerate in the middle interval and medium-coarse sandstone in the up interval. The oil bearing gradevaries from oil stains, oil spot to oil immersion accordingly.

From analysis result of the core data (Figure 6), it clearly showed the good relationship between particle size and oil bearing grade. As the particle size decreasing from medium conglomerate to medium sandstone, the oil bearing grade is increasing. And as the particle size decreasing from fine sandstone to shaly siltstone, the oil bearing grade is also decreasing. Pebbly medium sand and medium sand dominate the highest oil bearing grade.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Oil bearing grade for different lithology from core analysis.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Oil bearing grade for different lithology from core analysis.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The upper and lower percentiles used are user-defined, 70 and 30 are the defaults. A resistivity image spectrum iscalculated circumferentially aroundthe wellbore over a short interval and the sorting index is calculated from the percentile resistivity distributionof the image histogram (Figure 7). The sorting index which may have a relationship with grainsize, rock texture or facies type. It must be verified and validated with core data if to be taken as grain/pore size indicator.

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: Resistivity spectrum analysis from the image data

formatted-caption.caption-text: Resistivity spectrum analysis from the image data

linkTarget.anchoringText: For this well, the sorting index statistics result shows the sorting index decreases from median conglomerate to medium sand stone, and begins to increase from fine sandstone. For the medium sandstone, the sorting index is the smallest and the oil bearing grade is the highest. As the particle size increasing from medium sandstone to medium conglomerate, the sorting index is increasing and the oil bearing grade is decreasing. As the particle size decreasing from medium sandstone to siltstone, the sorting index is increasing and the oil bearing grade is decreasing. So the sorting index has very close relationship with the particle size and oil bearing grade (Figure 8).

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Sorting index statistics analysis for different lithology.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Sorting index statistics analysis for different lithology.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The detailed resistivity spectrum result indicated (Figure 9): the resistivity spectrum is wider for conglomerate compared with course sandstone, medium sand and fine sandstone; the wider of the spectrum, the less of the cross bedding is developed on the image. Above all, for the same lithology, the more heterogeneity of the image texture, the wider of this spectrum.
The model is built following three steps (Fig10):

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: Image based Reservoir Rock type Analysis

formatted-caption.caption-text: Image based Reservoir Rock type Analysis

linkTarget.anchoringText: The statistic result of oil bearing grade from core data for each RRT indicated(Fig 11): 1) RRT has good relationship with oil bearing grade; 2) Good RRT is dominated with oil immersion; 3) Good to Moderate RRT is dominated with oil spot; 4) Moderate RRT is dominated with oil stains and Poor RRT is dominated with no oily.

image-wrap.label: Figure 11
image-wrap.caption: Oil bearing grade analysis for different Reservoir rock type

formatted-caption.caption-text: Oil bearing grade analysis for different Reservoir rock type

linkTarget.anchoringText: This methodologywas applied in anther complex clastic reservoir of Xinjiang oilfield. The study area is located at Mahu depression and the target zone is Permian and Jurassic formation. Thelithology ismainlyconglomeratethat’s interbedded with sandstone and the sedimentary environment is deltaic. The conventional logs have asimilar response within the conglomeraticintervals (Figure 12). But from the image texture analysis and core observation, it is obvious that the rock is massive with high heterogeneity, the particle size is varying a lot within one meter interval andthe conglomerate is interbedded with sandstone (Figure 13).

image-wrap.label: Figure 12
image-wrap.caption: Simiar Logs response within the conglomerate interval

formatted-caption.caption-text: Simiar Logs response within the conglomerate interval

linkTarget.anchoringText: This methodologywas applied in anther complex clastic reservoir of Xinjiang oilfield. The study area is located at Mahu depression and the target zone is Permian and Jurassic formation. Thelithology ismainlyconglomeratethat’s interbedded with sandstone and the sedimentary environment is deltaic. The conventional logs have asimilar response within the conglomeraticintervals (Figure 12). But from the image texture analysis and core observation, it is obvious that the rock is massive with high heterogeneity, the particle size is varying a lot within one meter interval andthe conglomerate is interbedded with sandstone (Figure 13).

image-wrap.label: Figure 13
image-wrap.caption: High heterogeneity of rock texture within short interval Medium Conglomerate, Medium Conglomerate, Fine Conglomerate, Medium-Coarse Sandstone, Fine Conglomerate Coarse Sand

formatted-caption.caption-text: High heterogeneity of rock texture within short interval Medium Conglomerate, Medium Conglomerate, Fine Conglomerate, Medium-Coarse Sandstone, Fine Conglomerate Coarse Sand

linkTarget.anchoringText: The image based methodology is executed combined with effective porosity and clay content for this well. The RRT result is summarizedin Fig14 shows.
